newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Telstra to outsource directory services.
newsitem.headline: Telstra to outsource directory services.

text.p: State-owned telephone carrier Telstra Corp Ltd said on Friday it planned to outsource its National Directory Services (NDS) operations to Pacific Access Pty Ltd, a company in which Telstra will increase its stake.

Telstra said from July 1, 1997, Pacific Access would assume responsibility for NDS operations including the management and production of printed and electronic White Pages directories and Yellow Pages directory printing and distribution.
Telstra also planned to acquire a 12.5 percent stake in Pacific Access from SBC International Inc, a unit of SBC Communications, lifting its stake to 62.5 percent.
Other Pacific Access shareholders are Edward H.O'Brien Industries Pty Ltd, Tele-Direct Publications International B.V. and Volt Australia, each with a 12.5 percent percent stake, Telstra said.

"With responsibilities for NDS operations, Pacific Access will become the largest directory management company in the southeast Asian region," Telstra Multimedia chief executive officer Gerry Moriarty said in a statement.
"It will be well positioned to export its expertise internationally, assisting Telstra's aim of providing global communications services," Moriarty said.
From July 1, 1997, Pacific Access would also supply services to the Laos and would pursue opportunities in Asia, including Vietnam, Cambodia and Indonesia, Telstra said.
